Sub:      Ladder Point Check by the Airlines. 
 
In supersession of this Bureau Circular No. 29/2003 dated 10.10.2003 
the following instructions on the above subject shall be strictly implemented by all 
concerned with immediate effect. 
 
 
It has been decided by the government to dispense with ladder point 
frisking at all airports other than those in J&K and the North East Region,  subject 
to following conditions: 
 
(a) 
Availability of aerobridges or availability of dedicated vehicles in which 
the security cleared passengers are transported duly escorted  by 
airlines staff/ commercial staff. 
(b) 
Availability of upgraded technology for hand baggage x-ray screening 
in conjunction with effective and well calibrated use of  DFMDs and 
HHMDs. 
(c) 
Availability of trained and certified x-ray screeners and frisking staff. 
(d) 
Re-designed security hold areas with introduction of tray system to 
collect metallic objects from the passengers. 
(e) 
Placement of x-ray based Baggage Inspection System (BIS) closer to 
check-in-counter. 
(f) 
Complete sanitization of the security hold area. 
 
However, it has also been decided that the secondary ladder point 
checks should be restored under the following circumstances: 
 
(a) 
At times of high alert. 
(b) 
For operational requirements and on the basis of intelligence inputs. 
(c) 
For random checks. 
(d) 
For determining efficiency of the security staff. 
(e) 
When the threat perception to a particular airport so demands. 
 
 
(M. Malaviya)
